name: rakish shawl
notes:
release the hounds(tooth)! a classic autumnal pattern in a classic shawl shape for a finished piece that is dashing and a touch unexpected – perfection. this is a shawl for all your fall-inspired fantasies.

sizes
one size/adjustable

finished measurements
approx. 72” wingspan by 32” deep.

sample shown
color a: big birdie in pop rocks,
color b: tod worsted in island bunny.

*variation: use big birdie for both color a and color b. to knit the shawl we show here you’ll need 3 skeins of color a, blackbird (approx. 480 yds), and 2 skeins of color b, peanut (approx. 320 yds). we used a us 10.5 (6.5mm) needle for the shawl body and went down to a us 10 (6mm) for the ribbing. your finished size will be approx. 78” wingspan x 36” deep along spine. your gauge will measure approx. 13 sts/15 rows over 4”.*

yarn requirements
*please note these are yarn estimates. the amount used will depend on yarn, your personal gauge, and any modifications you make.*
color a: dimond laine big birdie (79% alpaca, 21% silk, 174 yards per 100g skein); 3 skeins.
color b: the lamb & kid tod worsted (65% yak, 35% cashmere, 114 yards per 50g skein); 3 skeins.

or

color a: 440 yds / 400m of aran weight yarn,
color b: 290 yds / 265m of worsted weight yarn,

total yardage: 730 yds / 665m.

suggested needles
*needles listed are suggested.*
gauge needle: us 10 (6mm) 32” circular needles.
*optional:* us 10.5 (6.5mm), or needle one size larger than gauge needle for bind-off.

tools
4 stitch markers, tapestry needle.

gauge
*while gauge is not crucial, it will affect overall yardage used and the overall finished dimensions.*
approx. 15 sts/20 rows = 4” in mosaic houndstooth stitch, after blocking.





  [1]: https://thelambandkid.com/collections/kits
